intro: Rudgea enervia, commonly known as the velvetleaf or velvetleaf tree, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, soft hairs, giving it a velvety texture. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Rudgea enervia is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in moist, well-drained soils.
